title: EU Talks on Economic Recovery Aid to Enter Third Day
summary: Major differences remain regarding amount of grants that would be handed out to struggling governments. BRUSSELS-Talks among European Union leaders on a €1.8 trillion ($2 trillion) economic recovery package will stretch into a third day on Sunday, with the bloc's 27 governments still at loggerheads on key parts of the plan.

title: Canada Bars Blue Jays From Playing Home Games in Toronto
summary: Official cites public health risk from players, staff traveling to and from Covid-19 hot spots in the U.S.. Canada won't allow the Blue Jays to play Major League Baseball games in Toronto this season, citing the risk posed by team players and staff traveling to parts of the U.S. where the risk of Covid-19 transmission is elevated.

title: Disney Slashed Ad Spending on Facebook Amid Growing Boycott
summary: Hundreds of advertisers have paused spending on social network due to concerns about hate speech, divisive content. Walt Disney Co. has dramatically slashed its advertising spending on Facebook Inc., according to people familiar with the situation, the latest setback for the tech giant as it faces a boycott from companies upset with its handling of hate speech and divisive content.

title: Tyrese Haspil, Accused Killer of Gokada CEO Fahim Saleh, Arraigned on Murder Charge
summary: Manhattan prosecutors say video shows Mr. Haspil buying electric saw after alleged killing. A former executive assistant accused of fatally stabbing and dismembering a New York City tech entrepreneur was seen on video buying an electric saw at a hardware store after the killing, according to the Manhattan district attorney's office.

title: Hot-Pot Lab Is Latest Food-Focused Museum to Bubble Up
summary: Following popularity of Museum of Ice Cream and Museum of Pizza, entrepreneurs are creating space celebrating favorite Asian dish. New York City's cultural venues may largely be on pause because of the coronavirus pandemic. But that hasn't deterred some entrepreneurs from creating a museum-style pop-up attraction devoted to the Chinese hot-pot culinary tradition.

title: Exelon Unit to Pay $200 Million to Settle Illinois Bribe Case
summary: Associates of long-serving Speaker Michael Madigan received jobs, contracts, ComEd admits. CHICAGO- Exelon Corp.'s Commonwealth Edison unit agreed to pay a $200 million fine for a long-running bribery scheme in which the utility gave jobs and contracts to associates of Illinois House Speaker Michael Madigan, the state's most powerful politician for decades, the U.S. attorney's office for the Northern District of Illinois said Friday.

title: Career Reboot: She Followed Her Heart Into Data Analytics
summary: Unhappy in her job at a law firm, a recruiter did research, learned skills and found her new career in tech. Martha Jones once had her heart set on a law career.

title: French Officials Investigate Arson After Fire Burns Through Nantes Cathedral
summary: The blaze, which damaged precious artifacts, revived memories of the devastating fire in Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris last year. PARIS-French authorities opened an investigation into arson after a fire broke out Saturday in a cathedral in the western city of Nantes.

title: Tens of Thousands March in Russia's Far East, Defying Kremlin
summary: The arrest of the regional governor has prompted residents to air other grievances. MOSCOW-Tens of thousands of people in Russia's Far East marched in protests triggered by the arrest of a popular regional governor, but that have since morphed into a wave of growing dissatisfaction over social issues and the rule of President Vladimir Putin.

title: Travel Is Bouncing Back, but Tourists Stick Close to Home
summary: Resume Subscription. A New Zealand ski resort recently staffed up as locals piled in. Vacationing South Koreans, with few foreigners in sight, pack the buffet lines at fancy hotels. Cottage rentals in the U.K. have nearly doubled over last year-mainly driven by British travelers.

title: Covid-19 Remakes Elevator Etiquette
summary: Office buildings limit passengers and require masks to mitigate risk; upgraded ventilation for elevators could help.

title: Here's What Double-Digit Unemployment Could Mean for the Election
summary: Does a high unemployment rate mean the incumbent will lose? Not necessarily.. President Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden are campaigning for the White House in an unusual economic atmosphere for a presidential election: double-digit unemployment.

title: Trump Team Faces Major Test Over Extending Pandemic Relief
summary: Next aid package will be critical in shaping the pace of recovery from the biggest crisis since the Great Depression. The White House's freewheeling approach to policy-making faces a key test next week as negotiations begin with Congress over extending emergency economic relief measures during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: A Better Plan for Istanbul's Hagia Sophia
summary: The historic structure is reverting from a museum to a mosque, but a hybrid approach would better honor its diverse lineage while keeping it open to all.. I owe my vocation as a historian to Hagia Sophia in Istanbul, which I first visited as a boy during my first trip abroad.

title: The End of the Trans-Atlantic Tariff Truce
summary: With the room for tax compromises between Washington and Brussels shrinking, investors in marquee European companies need to start worrying about tariffs again. It can be easy to grow complacent about a small but steady drip, but if it continues for too long, at some point the dam gives way.

title: Firms With Troubled Pasts Got Millions in PPP Aid
summary: Paycheck Protection Program benefited alleged Ponzi scheme and companies accused of defrauding student borrowers and selling fake coronavirus treatments. Last November, a federal judge ordered an asset freeze against a California company that the Federal Trade Commission accused of pretending to be working with the Education Department and promising student-loan debt relief that never materialized.

title: A Routine to Boost Your Posture-and Help You Ace Tennis
summary: Resume Subscription. Anatomy of a Workout is a new column where sports performance coaches and athletic trainers break down exercises and drills they use with the pros. Each column will focus on functional movements that help build overall athleticism and translate to everyday activities.

title: Brooks Brothers' Latest Suitor Wants to Bring Italian Flair to American Fashion
summary: Group of investors plans to close stores, boost bankrupt brand's online presence. The race to buy Brooks Brothers out of bankruptcy is about to get a little more crowded with a group of Italian investors planning to bid for the quintessential American clothing brand and introduce some European flair.

title: What Banks Tell Us About Business: Everybody Is Struggling
summary: Four biggest American banks nearly doubled amount set aside to cover soured corporate loans. Big banks expect the coronavirus recession to cut a wide swath through corporate America.

title: Twitter Says Hackers Downloaded Some Users' Personal Data in Recent Attack
summary: Hackers were able to extract personal data of up to eight users in the attack, which targeted 130 accounts. Twitter Inc. said the hackers behind this week's attack on its systems and high-profile users walked away with some personal information, indicating that the perpetrators carried out more than a cryptocurrency-related scam.

title: John Lewis, U.S. Congressman and Civil Rights Icon, Dies
summary: Martin Luther King aide and longtime lawmaker, a hero to many in Congress, was severely beaten in 1965 march. WASHINGTON-John Lewis, the champion of civil rights for Black Americans whose activism brought him from the bloodied streets of Selma, Ala., to the marble halls of Congress, died Friday. He was 80 years old.

title: The Next Phase of the Retail Apocalypse: Stores Reborn as E-Commerce Warehouses
summary: As the demand for in-person shopping diminishes, landlords, startups and retailers are converting abandoned stores into online fulfillment centers. When Litisha Thomas heard through the gossip mill that the shuttered Sam's Club where she'd worked for 11 years might be reopening in her rural North Carolina hamlet, she immediately jumped on an internet job board to see if it was hiring. It was, but this wasn't a conventional reopening.

title: For Summer Cooking, the Secret Ingredient Is Temperature
summary: In the hottest months, a perfect meal can range from icy melon to cold chicken to just-boiled corn.. Traditionally, the way to serve melon in France was to put it in a bucket down a well for an hour or so before dinner, making it ice cold. On a summer's evening, the orange-fleshed melon would be served as a refreshing appetizer, all by itself or perhaps with a few slices of dry-cured ham. A ripe melon was seen by French eaters as a feast, so long as it was cold enough.

title: Economy Looms Larger for Trump's Campaign
summary: President touts rising stock market, his regulatory cuts. As grim news and bad indicators pile up elsewhere for President Trump's re-election effort, his promise to lead an economic rebound is growing in importance.

title: Why These Black Designers Are the Future of Fashion
summary: Virgil Abloh, Tracy Reese, Olivier Rousteing and Ozwald Boateng share the creative designers of color they are most excited about. IN THE 1975 camp classic "Mahogany," Diana Ross stars as an aspiring fashion designer who ultimately-and rather implausibly-overcomes and transcends racial discrimination to parlay a modeling career into her own luxury label in Rome.

title: The Dimming of GE's Bold Digital Dreams
summary: The industrial giant hoped to remake itself as a software powerhouse. Here's what went wrong.. In early 2014, the High-Impact Innovation Team in General Electric Co.'s Connecticut headquarters received an urgent call: It was time to present one of their apps to Jeff Immelt. The chief executive had an expanding interest in tech, having promised an "industrial internet" that GE would help build for the world.

title: U.S. Virus Cases Hit Another Daily Record as State GOP Officials Target Mask Orders
summary: New coronavirus infections world-wide hit single-day record of 249,800 as U.S. death toll surpasses 138,900. Plans laid out by California and Texas suggest many children in each state will start the school year virtually, as coronavirus cases rose to another daily record and measures to slow the spread of the virus continued to meet political resistance.

title: In Portland, Protests Continue and Federal Agents Arrive, Raising Tensions
summary: Local officials call for daily marches to end while decrying the presence of federal law enforcement, which the Trump administration says is needed to defend government buildings. PORTLAND, Ore.-On the 47th consecutive day of protests in this city, more than 200 people marched across the Morrison Bridge into the center of downtown to hear a speech by a Black woman who said her son had been killed by police.

title: Hospitals Appeal Decision Upholding Disclosure of Negotiated Rates
summary: American Hospital Association says rule would force members to disclose proprietary information. The American Hospital Association on Friday appealed a decision upholding a Trump administration rule that requires hospitals disclose the rates they negotiate with insurance companies that aren't made public.

summary: Here are major companies whose shares moved on the week's news. Citigroup Inc.

title: SFO to Review Its Conduct in Unaoil Bribery Case
summary: The review follows questions from a U.K. judge about communication between prosecutors and a private investigator. The U.K.'s Serious Fraud Office said it would review its conduct in the prosecution of individuals in a Unaoil Group bribery case after a judge questioned the nature of communication between a private investigator and the agency.
